column1: Holman "Long Hom" Cotton was a Hobbit of Bywater.
Holman was the son of Cotman. He moved to Bywater
column2: and took up the family name "Cotton Family".  He became a farmer
column4: Tolman Cotton Senior. He also had another son

column2: and is distinct from the real-life English surname
column3: p. 760 which contains holm "river island" rather than hol "hole".
